questions.prompt: Which structure is found in plant cells but NOT in animal cells?
questions.explanation: Plant cells have a rigid cell wall for support; animal cells do not.

questions.prompt: What is the main function of the cell membrane?
choices: Control what enters and leaves the cell
questions.explanation: The membrane is selectively permeable, regulating movement of substances in and out.

questions.prompt: Which organelle is most directly responsible for producing ATP for the cell?
questions.explanation: Mitochondria perform cellular respiration to generate ATP energy.

questions.prompt: DNA is primarily located in which part of a eukaryotic cell?
questions.explanation: In eukaryotes, most DNA is stored in the nucleus.

questions.prompt: Which statement best describes a prokaryotic cell?
questions.explanation: Prokaryotes do not have a nucleus or membrane-bound organelles.

questions.prompt: Ribosomes are the site of which cell process?
questions.explanation: Ribosomes assemble amino acids into proteins.

questions.prompt: Which organelle modifies, sorts, and packages proteins for transport?
questions.explanation: The Golgi prepares proteins (and lipids) for delivery to other parts of the cell or outside.

questions.prompt: In the microscope, which unit is commonly used to measure cell size?
questions.explanation: Cells are typically measured in micrometers (µm), which are much smaller than millimeters.
